summary: This bill, the Stratton Ridge Air Force Memorial Act, authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture to relocate a memorial honoring nine Air Force crew members who died in a 1982 airplane crash. The relocation would be to the Stratton Ridge rest area in the Nantahala National Forest in North Carolina.  The bill specifies that no federal funds can be used for the relocation and the costs are borne by the entity requesting the relocation. It also outlines site approval and potential terms and conditions for the special use authorization.
